fd.recommendation: Park in a reliable bank FD for stability and 7-8% returns

gold.recommendation: Buy digital gold or sovereign gold bonds for inflation hedge

debt_funds.recommendation: Short-duration debt funds for liquidity and steady income

what_if_analysis.conservative_return: If you get 8% per annum, after 2 years: FV = 12000 x (1 + 0.08)^2 = ₹14006; gain of ₹2006.
what_if_analysis.moderate_return: At target 13% per annum: FV = 12000 x (1 + 0.13)^2 = ₹15303; gain of ₹3303.

summary: Your portfolio mixes large-cap strong-stability stocks, a top large-cap fund, and safe diversifiers (FD, gold, debt). It aims for moderate growth with good protection against market swings. You get three sectors: Financials, Consumer, and Industrials, ensuring balance.

risk_analysis.mild_crash: 10% drop: Portfolio falls to ₹10,800; you lose ₹1,200. Diversifiers limit deeper losses.
risk_analysis.moderate_crash: 20% drop: Portfolio drops to ₹9,600; biggest impact would be on stocks, but debt/gold soften the hit.
risk_analysis.severe_crash: 30% drop: Value falls to ₹8,400; stocks may be most affected, but FDs/gold stay stable.
risk_analysis.summary: Diversification with FDs, debt, and gold buffers your downside. Stock risk is spread across sectors, limiting single-company losses.

education_tips.diversification_importance: Diversifying across stocks, funds, and asset types helps protect you from shocks in one sector.
education_tips.long_term_perspective: Equity volatility evens out over longer time frames. Stay invested for at least 2+ years for expected growth.
education_tips.rebalancing_strategy: Review portfolio after 12 months—rebalance if stocks/funds outgrow their share by more than 10%.
education_tips.understanding_risk: Don't panic in down markets—your allocation means losses are limited and recovery is likely over 2 years.
